output_questions.question: What color?
output_questions.explanation: The last rule wins due to the cascade: the paragraph will be red.

output_questions.question: Check color
output_questions.explanation: ID selectors have higher specificity than type selectors, so the text is green.

output_questions.question: Heading
output_questions.explanation: Class selectors are more specific than type selectors, so the heading is purple.

output_questions.question: Test
output_questions.explanation: ID selector wins over the type selector due to higher specificity.

output_questions.question: Priority?
output_questions.explanation: `!important` overrides normal cascade and specificity rules.

output_questions.question: Color?
output_questions.explanation: The selector `#main.special` is more specific than `.special` alone.

output_questions.question: Final color?
output_questions.explanation: The last property value in order wins, so the color is green.

output_questions.question: Which important?
output_questions.explanation: When both are `!important`, the last one in order wins.

output_questions.question: Which color?
output_questions.explanation: ID selectors are more specific than class selectors, so green wins.

output_questions.question: Test
output_questions.explanation: The descendant selector has higher specificity than the type selector.

output_questions.question: Inline style
output_questions.explanation: Inline styles have higher specificity than CSS rules.

output_questions.question: Which one?
output_questions.explanation: `body p` is more specific than just `p`.

output_questions.question: Responsive color
output_questions.output:
Responsive color

output_questions.explanation: The color is blue unless the media query matches, in which case it becomes red.

output_questions.question: Color?
output_questions.explanation: `p#main` is more specific than `p`, so orange is applied.

output_questions.question: Actual
output_questions.explanation: Commented HTML tags are ignored, so the rule applies to the only actual paragraph.
